snippet: Many New York City officers live in the suburbs, and the issue had not been raised until the Rev. Al Sharpton asked a yes-or-no question at a debate for mayoral contenders Tuesday night.
abstract: Rev Al Sharpton surprises panel of five Democratic mayoral hopefuls and asks if New York City police officers should be required to live in New York City, during debate at his National Action Network headquarters in Harlem; question catches them off guard and elicits divergent answers.
lead_paragraph: Many New York City officers live in the suburbs, and the issue had not been raised until the Rev. Al Sharpton asked a yes-or-no question at a debate for mayoral contenders Tuesday night.

headline.seo: N.Y.C. Mayoral Candidates Differ on Residency Rule for Police
headline.main: Candidates Diverge on Residency for Police
headline.print_headline: Candidates Diverge On Residency For Police
